metadata.title: CVE-2022-27378 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
An issue in the component Create_tmp_table::finalize of MariaDB Server v10.7 and below was discovered to allow attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) via specially crafted SQL statements.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-27378` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadb3 - 1:10.6.8-1
libmariadbd19 - 1:10.6.8-1
mariadb-backup - 1:10.6.8-1
mariadb-client - 1:10.6.8-1
mariadb-client-10.6 - 1:10.6.8-1
mariadb-client-core-10.6 - 1:10.6.8-1
mariadb-common - 1:10.6.8-1
mariadb-plugin-connect - 1:10.6.8-1
mariadb-plugin-cracklib-password-check - 1:10.6.8-1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-client - 1:10.6.8-1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-server - 1:10.6.8-1
mariadb-plugin-mroonga - 1:10.6.8-1
mariadb-plugin-oqgraph - 1:10.6.8-1
mariadb-plugin-rocksdb - 1:10.6.8-1
mariadb-plugin-s3 - 1:10.6.8-1
mariadb-plugin-spider - 1:10.6.8-1
mariadb-server - 1:10.6.8-1
mariadb-server-10.6 - 1:10.6.8-1
mariadb-server-core-10.6 - 1:10.6.8-1
mariadb-test - 1:10.6.8-1
mariadb-test-data - 1:10.6.8-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.6 package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:10.6.8-1').
